titles.title: To clarify that a reasonable suspicion, sufficient to support a constitutional stop and frisk by a law enforcement officer, includes membership in a criminal street gang that engages in a pattern of criminal gang activity.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E945)
Referred to the House Committee on Judiciary.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR H3529)
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime and Criminal Justice.

bill.summary: 5/17/1994--Introduced. Provides that it shall constitute a reasonable suspicion, sufficient to support a constitutional stop and frisk by a law enforcement officer, that the officer knows or has reason to believe that the person who is subject to that stop and frisk: (1) actively participates in a criminal street gang; and (2) knows that such criminal street gang engages in a pattern of criminal gang activity.
